text: Everybody thinks that wrappers, apps that take generic large-language models and put a UI on
top of them to customize it for specific use cases or audiences, won't make much money,
like Liner for search. They think that they'll get copied by model makers or by clones and
their profit margins will go away. And they're all wrong. Research from our course shows that
these wrappers are actually quite profitable and are growing significantly, usually at least at
a 20% profit margin and a two to three times year-over-year growth. And this makes sense,
by the way. Over 90% of the world's population don't use ChatGPT or anything similar on even
a somewhat regular basis, if they've used it at all. And so making GenAI accessible to this market
is a wide open opportunity. And the few companies who are targeting this are making a killing doing
